title: Extensive footage of EA's new The Sims "game concept" surfaces online
description: The Sims 4 might be tootling along merrily, but it's now over ten years old and fans are getting increasingly impatient for clarity on what's next for the franchise - particularly given EA's somewhat confounding communications on the matter. Amid all this, extensive footage of EA's new The Sims "game concept" have now surfaced online, fuelling all sorts of disappointment as fans ponder a reality where the future of The Sims is, in fact, just a tacky looking mobile game. title: ZeniMax union "overwhelmingly" votes to authorise strike if Microsoft contract negotiations drag on
description: Members of the ZeniMax Workers United union - which is made up of more than 300 quality assurance workers across ZeniMax Studios - has "overwhelmingly" voted to authorise union leadership to call for a strike if no resolution is reached following two years of unsuccessful contract negotiations with Microsoft. title: Legend Of Zelda Manga Box Set With Treasure Chest Case Gets Huge Discount
description: The Legend of Zelda Manga - Legendary Edition Box Set $73 (was $125) See at Amazon The collector's box set of the original Zelda manga series is on sale for over $50 off at Amazon. Normally $125, The Legend of Zelda Legendary Edition Box Set is discounted to just $73 right now. The collection comes with the full series across five premium books, a very cool treasure chest display case, and an exclusive poster. With Amazon's deal, you're only spending five bucks more on the superior Legendary Edition Box Set than you would on the standard trade paperback box set.The Legendary Edition Box Set is one of two superb Zelda manga box set deals you can score right now; Amazon also has the 11-volume Twilight Princess Box Set for $73, down from $130. The 2,040-page reimagining of the hit Nintendo Wii and GameCube game released in box set format last September. The Legend of Zelda Manga - Legendary Edition Box Set $73 (was $125) The original Zelda manga received 10 volumes throughout its run. Each Legendary Edition book contains two volumes in one. The manga puts its own spin on six games in Nintendo's iconic series, including Ocarina of Time, Majora's Mask, and Oracle of Ages/Seasons, The Minish Cap, Phantom Hourglass, and Four Swords.All told, the Legendary Edition spans 1,910 pages across the five books. These deluxe editions offer noticeable improvements compared to the standard trade paperback editions of the original Zelda manga. All five books have exclusive covers and a few full-color art pieces. The build quality and presentation is noticeably better thanks to the use of higher-quality paper, thicker covers, and more durable bindings.The Legend of Zelda Manga Box Sets:The Legend of Zelda Manga - Legendary Edition Box Set -- $73 ($125)The Legend of Zelda Manga - Standard Box Set -- $68 ($105)The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess Complete Box Set -- $73 ($130) See at Amazon The Legend of Zelda Manga - Legendary EditionsIf you don't want to commit to the whole set, you can buy each of the Legendary Editions individually. Each book carries a $20 MSRP, though you can save at least a few bucks on all of them, including The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time, a two-part adaptation of the N64 classic that's on sale for $15 in Legendary Edition format.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Nightdive Studios Wants To Start Remastering PS3 And Xbox 360 Games
description: Nightdive Studios, a company known for efforts in updating and preserving outdated video games, has revealed that it would like to start remastering games from the PS3 and Xbox 360 era.In an interview with VGC, studio head Stephen Kick and director of business development Larry Kuperman said that they want to look at games that were only released on PS3 and Xbox 360 for potential remasters. When taking into consideration which games that could be remastered, Kuperman said that there are many factors that come into play.These include things like having access to the game's source code and original assets, as well as examining what consoles the game currently lives on. Games that are exclusive to one console, for example, might be more in need of a refresh. This is what makes tackling PS3 and Xbox 360 era titles such an exciting prospect.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: We need some better terms for GenAI output - "slop" is too benign
description: Earlier this month, Snail Games put out a widely and justifiably clowned-on genAI trailer for Ark: Survival Evolved's Aquatica DLC. Much reporting on the incident, including my own, used some variation of "slop" in the headline. This has likely been true for some time, but it made me notice that 'slop' had evolved from a common adjective into the realm of de facto terminology. If you dislike GenAI, you refer to its output as 'slop'. It's become lexi-canonical. I think we can do better. "Slop" evokes a tepid cylinder of condensed cream of mushroom soup, glumly wibbling in a chipped bowl. When I think of GenAI, I picture something closer to tropical insects laying eggs beneath soft flesh of victims. There's something parasitical and sinister about flaying the skin of artists who've explicitly spoken out against GenAI and then gleefully parading around in that stolen flesh. Slop sounds like Soft sounds like Plop sounds like Globule. It slides down too easy; gets off too lightly. Read more
author: Nic Reuben

title: The Mosquito Gang pits four blood-sucking insect players against a human who just wants to do the dishes
description: Every year, the fruit flies and mosquitoes return to my kitchen, drawn to the illicit aroma of unlidded pasta sauce and the rank embroidery of carbonised toast around my cooker. Every year, I attempt to remove them non-violently by building intricate traps out of vinegar bottles, or performing slow-motion kung fu punches with a jug. My inability to keep the winged hoodlums at bay has alienated me from my so-called friends, but on the plus side, it has also equipped me to play The Mosquito Gang, an asymmetrical multiplayer affair in which one, regular-sized human player attempts to carry out various domestic tasks while four, tiny mosquito players attempt to suck their blood. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 872
description: Soâ€¦what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isnâ€™t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. Itâ€™s just a list of more or less random questions Iâ€™ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. What could you use most right now: cuddles with pets, a hot cup of tea or a nap? Iâ€™m drinking a hot cup of tea at the moment, and Iâ€™m not too sleepy, so Iâ€™ll take the cuddles from the pets. 2. On a scale of 1-10, with 10 being the highest, how concerned are you about AI? Girl. As someone who named her daughter after a great science fiction heroine who rises up to help defeat the robots, Iâ€™m going to give this a solid 10. Iâ€™m freaked out, man! 3. title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 856
description: Rosie, being scientifically oriented, has an affinity for baking. She appreciates the precision and thinks of it like working in a lab, except one where youâ€™re able to sample the fruits of your labor. Weâ€™re all so excited because she opened her new French bakery, La boulangerie de Rosie, in Novato this weekend. I know! Very exciting. Unfortunately for Rosie, Marnie was her baking assistant, but it doesnâ€™t look like thatâ€™s going to work out because Marnie has no regard for recipes or measurementsâ€¦or really, any kind of precision. Actually, Rosie didnâ€™t come up with the idea for the bakery herself. Tabs, as you know, was very forwarding thinking, and toward the last years of his reign he planned to open a high-end cat bakery that also catered to humans (but also cats), and Rosie borrowed the idea. We can safely assume that if Tabs had gotten the business off the ground, it would have been a huge success.
